content:
1. c. Microorganism
2. b. Pathogen
3. c. Thayer-Martin agar
4. c. Intestinal tract
5. a. Darkness
6. e. Two of the above (acidic pH and light)
7. d. Aerobe
8. b. The temperature at which the microorganism grows best
9. e. Convalescent period
10. a. Urine, b. Blood
11. a. Use aseptic technique, b. Collect the appropriate amount of specimen, c. Label the specimen correctly
12. c. Streptococcus
13. d. Assist in the selection of the plating media
14. b. Help maintain a neutral pH by neutralizing fatty acids and absorbing toxic substances
15. a. Clean catch MSU
16. e. None of the above
17. b. Skin scraping
18. c. Blood
19. e. An arterial specimen
20. b. A special diet must be followed several days prior to collection
21. d. First thing in the morning before a bowel movement
22. c. Scotch tape/glass slide or sticky paddle
